Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with added white band near top of sherd and two white bands near bottom; exterior: painted decoration consisting of goat walking to right (trace of underbelly and parts of three legs remaining); concentric circles ringed with inverted T, cross and rising triangle as filling ornament; below, paired hook maeander band above simple guilloche in handle zone with, on far left, part of tongue pattern next to (lost) handle; below, wide band above maeander frieze running left.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.531. Lemos describes the sherd as part of the Group of the Aphrodite Bowl because the sherd displays a greater amount of variety in the filling ornaments than, though similar to, those on the Aphrodite Bowl (Lemos 1991, 74-5).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 238, no. 175, pl. 16)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0370) (phase 2)
